body_html:
Adding //tensorflow/core:framework_headers_lib produces an error saying the dependence is duplicated in the attributes of the build rule:

Label '//tensorflow/core:framework_headers_lib' is duplicated in the 'deps' attribute of rule 'wav_reader_op.so_check_deps'.

I think a part of the problem here is that 'reader_base.h' includes 'reader_base.pb.h' which appears to be part of the protocol buffer build output for reader_base. Bazel finds the file in the '/bazel-out/' folder and complains that the dependence wasn't declared. I only know protocol buffers and bazel well enough to be dangerous so I don't know what to do with that.

body:
Adding //tensorflow/core:framework_headers_lib produces an error saying the dependence is duplicated in the attributes of the build rule:

`Label '//tensorflow/core:framework_headers_lib' is duplicated in the 'deps' attribute of rule 'wav_reader_op.so_check_deps'.
`

I think a part of the problem here is that 'reader_base.h' includes 'reader_base.pb.h' which appears to be part of the protocol buffer build output for reader_base. Bazel finds the file in the '/bazel-out/' folder and complains that the dependence wasn't declared. I only know protocol buffers and bazel well enough to be dangerous so I don't know what to do with that.
